comments: Also convolution of A000984 with A038845, also convolution of A000302 with A002802, also convolution of A002457 with A002697. [_Rui Duarte_, Oct 08 2011]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = binomial(n+3, 3)*A000984(n+3)/A000984(3), where A000984 are the central binomial coefficients. - _Wolfdieter Lang_a(n) ~ 8/15*Pi^(-1/2)*n^(5/2)*2^(2*n)*{1 + 35/8*n^-1 + ...}. - Joe Keane (jgk(AT)jgk.org), Nov 22 2001a(n) = sum( a+b+c+d+e+f+g=n, f(a)*f(b)*f(c)*f(d)*f(e)*f(f)*f(g)) with f(n)=A000984(n) . - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Jan 22 2004a(n) = A000292(n)*A000984(n+2)/20. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 05 2007a(n) = ((2n+5)(2n+3)(2n+1)/(5*3*1)) * binomial(2n, n), a(n) = binomial(2n+6, 6) * binomial(2n, n) / binomial(n+3, 3), a(n) = binomial(n+3, 3) * binomial(2n+6, n+3) / binomial(6, 3). - _Rui Duarte_, Oct 08 2011a(n) = 4^n*hypergeom([-n,-5/2], [1], 1). - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 26 2016
maple: seq(binomial(2*n,n)*binomial(n,(n-3))/20, n=2..21); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 05 2007seq(simplify(4^n*hypergeom([-n,-5/2], [1], 1)),n=0..18); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 26 2016
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
